solution_line_template: If Doug, Betty's friend, is {doug_age} years old, and the sum of their ages is {sum_ages}, Betty is {sum_ages}-{doug_age} = <<{sum_ages}-{doug_age}={betty_age}>>{betty_age} years old.
Since twice Betty's age is the cost of a pack of nuts, a pack of nuts is sold at {multiplier_for_cost}*${betty_age} = $<<{multiplier_for_cost}*{betty_age}={cost_per_pack}>>{cost_per_pack}
If Betty wants to buy {packs_to_buy} packs of the nuts, she'll have to pay {packs_to_buy}*${cost_per_pack} = $<<{packs_to_buy}*{cost_per_pack}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
